"Not a sandbox like guerrilla but the destruction is even better and the weapons are so amazing, magnet gun is the most fun ive had in along time"

About This Game

Half a century after the Red Faction resistance and their Marauder allies freed Mars from the brutal Earth Defense Force, harmony on Mars is again threatened but this time by a lethal force shrouded in mystery.
When the massive Terraformer that supplies Mars with its Earth-like air and weather is destroyed, the atmosphere turns to chaos, super-tornados and lightning storms engulf the planet. To survive, the Colonists flee to the underground mines and build a network of habitable caves.
Five years later, Darius Mason , grandson of Martian Revolution heroes Alec Mason and Samanya , runs a lucrative business from Bastion, underground hub of Colonist activity. Mining, scavenging, mercenary work--if the job is dangerous, Darius is your man. Few sane people now venture to the ravaged surface, aside from contractors like Darius and the smugglers who run goods between the settlements.
When Darius is tricked into reopening a mysterious shaft in an old Marauder temple, he releases a long-dormant evil and unleashes Armageddon on Mars. As Colonist and Marauder settlements are torn asunder, only Darius and the Red Faction can save mankind. The battle will take them across the storm-blasted planet--and below it, to the very heart of the unspeakable threat.
Red Faction®: Armageddon™ expands on the critically acclaimed, best-selling franchise with new, groundbreaking challenges. You are humanity’s last hope for survival.

Key features:

  • Infestation Mode – Survive waves of enemy hordes in a 1-4 player cooperative, objective-based experience.
  • Ruin Mode – Master the tools of destruction in competitive and casual destruction-based modes.
  • Hell on Mars – Darius Mason can only watch as the surface of Mars is destroyed. Seeking solace underground, an even greater threat emerges against humanity.
  • Nano Forge – Unleash the devastating force of the Nano Forge with massive concussive blasts or reconstruct downed colonist defences with Geo-Mod 2.0.
  • Martian Underground – The truth behind an ancient evil will force Darius to wage a battle across the devastated Martian surface, beneath massive frozen glaciers, and over rivers of broiling magma.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows® XP
    • Processor: 2GHz Dual Core Processor (Intel Core 2 Duo or AMD Athlon™ X2) or higher
    • Memory: 2GB System RAM or more
    • Graphics: 320MB Video RAM, GPU w/ Shader Model 3.0 support, NVIDIA® GeForce® 88xx series or better, ATI Radeon™ HD30xx series or better
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 7.5 GB
    • Sound: 100% DirectX® 9.0C compliant sound card or equivalent onboard sound
    Recommended:
    • OS: Microsoft® Windows® 7
    • Processor: Any Quad Core Processor(Intel® Core i5 or AMD Phenom™ II X4) or 3.0+ Dual Core CPU
    • Memory: 4GB System RAM or more
    • Graphics: 1GB Video RAM, GPU w/ Shader Model 4.0 support, NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 400 series or better, ATI Radeon™ HD5000 series or better
    • DirectX®: 11
    • Hard Drive: 7.5 GB
    • Sound: 100% DirectX® 9.0C compliant sound card or equivalent onboard sound

46 of 52 people (88%) found this review helpful
3

1 person found this review funny
AbedsBrother
449 products in account
23 reviews
Recommended
44.1 hrs on record
Posted: May 13
Short game, but tons of fun. The weapons are some of the most unique I've ever come across, and are worth the purchase of the game. The game itself is narrow and linear, with awesome graphics (DX11) and decent voice-acting. Get it on sale and get ready for a fun 10 or so hours.

After finishing the game, I wanted to do more in the game world, but didn't want to play through the campaign again. Ruin mode (destroy the environment) is a lot of fun, but there are not enough maps and only two modes: Free Play and Challenge. Multi-player is fighting waves of enemies, in either Survive mode (what it says) or Defend mode (repair / defend something while waves of enemies attack). There are eight multiplayer maps, each in two varieties for 16 maps in all.

The "Path to War" DLC, now included for free, is a series of four missions that tie into the main campaign. There doesn't seem to be any reason for them to exist. Maybe the missions were rejected from the main campaign but the dev team were perhaps proud of the level design and released them anyway. The missions are fun, but it is a short, disjointed experience.

I'd like to think that the dev team, knowing THQ was facing troubled times (they went bankrupt shortly after the game's release), said something like, "However big or small our budget is, that's how big /small our game will be. Whatever. Let's make it the best game that we can." And they succeeded, it's a tremendously fun game. If you enjoy playing it as much as I did, at the end you'll be wanting more. But there is no more to be had...

JustJack6
90 products in account
20 reviews
Recommended
18.7 hrs on record
Posted: May 16
I will say one thing about this game: don't be a ♥♥♥♥ and deny it's good aspects purely because it's not open world like Guerrilla. If you've ever liked a linear, story driv- well, oriented shooter there's no discernible reason you won't like this. It might not touch your heart strings as much as say, Gears of War ('cos we all know how much of an emotional roller coaster that piece of overrated ♥♥♥♥ was) but it's got everything you need in a story and that's an incentive to play the game. The actual gameplay is pretty good, I enjoyed it at least. There's a variety of weapons, although you'll find your best suited 4 and probably won't use any others much after a while. Destructible environments are always fun and no one does them better than Volition.The repair... erm, thingy is not just a gimmick, it's not only a workaround for the occasional issue with destructible environments whereby you accidentally destroy the way forward but they've also made it actually useful by allowing you to repair cover and certain other things that are necessary to progress. I realize that was more than one thing but all in all there's not a lot to say about this game except don't be deterred by the fact that it's not open world like it's predecessor. That is my only reason for writing this review so just give it a chance. Who knows, you might find yourself enjoying it a little... scary thought for some I know.

Lunaril
537 products in account
176 reviews
Recommended
0.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 28
Red Faction: Armageddon is the Fourth game in the Red Faction series and the first game of the series I have played. The game is played in third-person, both as a single player campaign and in multiplayer mode. The story revolves around Terraforming operations on Mars and hostile Martian creatures who attack your Terraformer. The environment is destructible which is a departure from a lot of shooter-type games, and makes Red Faction particularly fun to play. Visually speaking, Red Faction: Armageddon seems pretty average for a shooter, though it was released in 2011. The story doesn't seem all that deep, but you do get to blow stuff up and rampage out, so I suppose like a hollywood movie, if you can't win them over with story, just add explosions. I give it a thumbs up, though I think there are better Shooters out there with more depth.

Bitches love cannons
114 products in account

Not Recommended
25.9 hrs on record
Posted: June 1
Let me take you back in time, to my youth of 2010. I discovered Red Faction: Guerrilla at my local Internet Cafe after school. I sat there, enjoyed myself as I destroyed literally EVERYTHING I could see. The game was a masterpiece, a beautiful black diamond amongst an unholy horde of ♥♥♥♥ coming from Infinity-Ward in the form of Call of Duty this, Call of Duty that, and Call of Duty blow it out your ♥♥♥.

Moving along to late 2011. Walking to school, and I look to the bus stop across the road from my house. New poster day, interesting. On the other side of the two-sided poster wall: Red Faction Armageddon. "A new one? WOW!!!" I thought to myself.

A year or two later, I get this game on Xbox. Yeah, bit slow, but I wasn't exactly rich. Anyway, play through it, and I'm like "but, where are all my destructions and my booms and my bangs and whats this annoying ♥♥♥♥ on my arm that keeps telling me what to do?"

So things I liked about this game:
- You can repair ♥♥♥♥. This would have been great in the previous game, because I lost a few missions because a ladder I had to climb broke. EDIT: Thanks to abedsbrother for informing me of the repair function in RFG. Still a pro on RFA because thats where it was first introduced.
- You get this super cool futuristic nano-gauntlet that can blast walls to kingdom come at the touch of a button (Mjolnir, you have been replaced). When fully upgraded, you can zap bugs into the air, launch ♥♥♥♥ for miles, activate a shield around you, and go Rambo- I mean Beserk.
- DUAL WIELDED HAND CANNONS

Things I hated about this game
- Theres less ♥♥♥♥ to destroy. Like literally, cmon man I wanted to see a giant ♥♥♥♥ing tower fall and destroy half of the town, not walk around some ♥♥♥♥ing pitch black cave that sucks balls.
- The world is no longer open. This legit means you are walking in one path. Constantly following the story. No fun to be had because no fun allowed. Zero replay value.
- DLC DLC DLC DLC DLC DLC DLC DLC DLC[/stike] Well at least they aren't Payday 2 but if they wanted to revive the franchise, remake this game only make it a ♥♥♥♥ing open world dip♥♥♥♥♥.
